title: Does your organization performs any of the following actions with the data: collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction?

answers.text: My organization does perform 1 or more of the enlisted actions
My organization does not carry out any related activity

title: Does your organization decides on aims and means of PD processing?
info: This means that organization takes full responsibility for actions being performed on the personal data

answers.text: Yes, my organization takes full responsibility for the granted personal data and its processing
No, my organization does processing on behalf of another organization and does not decide on aims of processing
Nothing of the above

title: Do individuals give a consent for processing their personal data? Do you provide them with a Consent Clause Form?

validExample.title: Examples of valid consent:
list: I would like to receive emails from [Brand name]
Sign me up for email communications
I understand and agree to the email marketing terms & conditions

info: Consent means offering individuals real choice and control. Genuine consent should put individuals in charge, build trust and engagement, and enhance your reputation.

answers.text: Yes, individuals give the explicit consent to the processing of their personal data for one or more specified purposes
No, individuals are not provided with a consent form or they are not asked for permission
I am not sure about the answer

references.title: Consent, forms & GDPR Best Practice Guide

title: Consent must be unambiguous. This means customers need to easily understand what they are signing up for. Is there any doubt in your statements?

validExample.title: Examples of valid consent:
list: I would like to receive emails from [Brand name]
Sign me up for email communications
I understand and agree to the email marketing terms & conditions

info: For information, please, visit the references from reference section

answers.text: Statements on the consent form of my organization are clear, precise and similar to ones from the valid example
Statements on the consent form of my organization are more similar to the ones on the invalid example
I am not sure about the answer

references.title: Consent, forms & GDPR Best Practice Guide

title: Do individuals sign a contract with your organization in order to process their personal data?
info: Whenever a controller uses a processor it needs to have a written contract in place.

answers.text: Organization has a contract with data subject whose Personal Data are being processed
No contract about personal data processing has been signed

title: Do you have to process their personal data to comply with your obligations under the contract?
info: Contract should be signed and preserved by both sides

answers.text: Yes, organization needs to process Personal Data to comply with itâ€™s obligations under the contract
No, organization processes data for different purpose

title: Did individual asked you to do something as a first step (eg provide a quote) and you need to process his personal data to do what he asks?
info: This means that an individual has performed direct request to your organization to process his/her personal data

answers.text: Yes, individuals perform specific request to my organization in order to process their personal data
No, there are no requests from individuals

title: Are you obliged to process the personal data to comply with the law?

validExample.title: Example of legal obligation
list: An employer needs to process personal data to comply with its legal obligation to disclose employee salary details to HMRC.
The employer can point to the HMRC website where the requirements are set out to demonstrate this obligation. In this situation it is not necessary to cite each specific piece of legislation.

info: There is a specific law of your country that requires you to collect personal data

answers.text: Yes, organization's intentions are similar to ones in the example
No, organization's intentions are different from ones in the example

title: Is the personal data processing necessary to protect vital interests of data subject or another natural person?

validExample.title: Example of vital interest
list: An individual has been taken by ambulance unconscious. Hospital has to process his personal data in order to save his life

info: Processing is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3

answers.text: Yes, the base for personal data processing is similar to one in the example
No, personal data are being processed for different purpose

title: Does your organization implement a task which has been assigned in the public interests or in terms of assistance for official authority?

validExample.title: Example of processing based on public interest
list: Your organization is a public authority (see 1st reference)

Processing is necessary for reasons of public interest in the area of public health, such as protecting against serious cross-border threats to health or ensuring high standards of quality and safety of health care and of medicinal products or medical devices, on the basis of Union or Member State law which provides for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject, in particular professional secrecy

Processing is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) based on Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject

info: Your organization has been assigned to assist official authority

answers.text: Yes, my organization performes a specific task similar to the enlisted in example section
No task has been assigned to my organization which would be similar to any of the examples
